result.execSummary:
The defendant Benjamin Allan Moore was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Benjamin Allan Moore

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: 4 month extension granted. now due May 22, 2017.
for an extension on fine filed by Ben Moore.

ADDRESS INFO for Benjamin Allan Moore
Current: 1801 Industrial St #8, Hudson, WI 54016 United States  (Effective: 01-23-2017)
Prior: 302  N. Fremont St., River Falls, WI 54022

02:59 Defendant Benjamin Allan Moore in court with attorney Philip A. Helgeson.  William H. Thorie appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Thorie plead to count, $443 fine defendant in program through St. Croix County. Atty Helgeson agrees.   Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form is filed with the court; court reviews with Def.   Constitutional rights explained to defendant.   Exam'd re: understanding of law, penalty and rights.   DEF PLEADS GUILTY.   Facts are correct.   COURT ACCEPTS PLEA, FINDS DEF FREELY, INTELLIGENTLY, KNOWINGLY & UNDERSTANDINGLY MADE AND WAIVES CONSTITUTIONAL RIGHTS.   The court finds the defendant guilty and adjudicates defendant guilty. Atty Helgeson and defendant address the court. Court orders: $443 fine includes DNA surcharge due in 6 months.   Appeal rights are given to the defendant. 03:06
Plea hearing on July 25, 2016 at 02:15 pm.

03:48 14CM230 also heard at this time.  Attorney Philip A. Helgeson in court. Defendant not in court, has car troubles, Atty Helgenson states his client is available by phone if necessary.  Sean Edward Froelich appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Froelich:  parties would like to set cases for plea in 3 months. Parties to see JA for plea date.  03:49
Status conference on April 18, 2016 at 03:15 pm.

10:21 Defendant Benjamin Allan Moore in court.  Rory Eoin O'Sullivan appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Liesl Nelson appeared in court with Def.   Defendant has copy of complaint. Court reads charges and possible penalties.  Defendant waives reading of the complaint.  Constitutional rights explained to defendant.  Exam'd re: understanding of law, penalty and rights. Def pleas not guilty. Court rec/enter. OSullivan: $1000 signature bond. Nelson has no objection.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 14, 2016 at 04:15 pm.
Clerk was to reschedule for February 22 and did not.

10:50 Defendant Benjamin Allan Moore not in court.  Sean Edward Froelich appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Froelich requests a bench warrant based on non appearance. Court will sign upon presentation.
